intro: Dicliptera spinosa, commonly known as the spiny dicliptera, is a perennial shrub native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Its fruits are berries that contain several seeds, and the plant is often found in disturbed soils and along roadsides. Due to its hardy nature, it is sometimes considered a weed in agricultural areas.
